text:
So, I ran into a problem I cannot fix:
I created a module for my HubSpot page. The Module alternates text blocks left then right then left and so on. This works fine. So far so good. Now I wanted to wrap the actual text of my blocks in <p> tags so that it predefines the blocks as paragraphs inside of HubSpot. Also worked like a charm for the text blocks that are generated when adding the module. If I however want to add in a new item to the module (a new text block) the styling is not automatically on paragraph. Obviously it is because i only wrapped the description text of my text blocks in my <RepeatedFieldGroup ...> tag in <p> tags. So it will only automatically set their styling to paragraph. Is there an easy approach to fix this?

A bit late to the party, but confirming that you can no longer update contact properties via the `identify` event except on legacy accounts.

Currently, my team’s best workaround to get the same functionality has been to create Custom Events that collect the contact properties, then use a workflow to map them to the Contact record.

It’s a lackluster solution, but I still haven’t found anything that looks like an “intended” replacement for this functionality.

Hey, I have a js bug on my website and don’t know where it is coming from. A non displayed image is showing and its a gif from a G2 tracker code, I have already removed the google tag and disabled the tracking from G2 but it is still showing. I was told to check Javascript settings, as when I disable JS on chrome it disappears. How do I get to see Javascript settings on HS? This tag is not inside any .js file, how is it being generated?
